31554,31554,bo0vxg,1557736620.0,WIBTA if i cut out my sister from my life due to how she behaved with my girlfriend?,"Background: I(21M) live with my sister(19F) in our parents apartment(they live abroad due to work). We only have ageeed on one rule that is that I don't bring any girls overnight without my sisters permission.(Which is crazy since we live in a big 3 bedroom apartment.) We both have our separate rooms and you don't get in the others way if you dont want to. I'm also in an Long Distance Relationship with my gf(25F), she lives about 2000km away from me.

Now recently I joked with my girlfriend that I would be always able to figure out if she was up-to something in regards to coming back and surprising me. Well yesterday she did just that. She called me and surprised me completely by being in front of my door.

My sister was home and my first reaction was to tell her that my gf surprised me and if you want to meet her, you have the chance. I didn't force her to do anything since she was in her home clothes and I know she doesn't like meeting people like that and I just let her know. I also told her 5 mins later that we will only be staying for an hour and taking the next train to my gf parents apartment. Now when I told this I noticed tears in her eyes so I went to talk to my gf and came back about 15 min later to find out what is going on.

Well turns our she was super upset since my gf showed up because according to her we had a rule where we can't bring ANYONE from the opposite sex(my case female) without the others permission and I'm like wtf, I never agreed to this. She brings up stuff like how she hasn't liked any of my ex-gfs and that it will be the same now.I tried to calm her down and tell her to think and that it's nothing craxy, she came here FOR AN HOUR. Well she changes and just runs outside without looking at my gf.
I tell my girlfriend this and she is upset understandably as she had good intentions in mind and she calls an uber and within 30 min we leave.

I call my mom and tell her the story, I said that I expect her to apologise to my gf and to me, because if she doesn't I'm not planning on living like that. My mom is like but she is your sister and family etc, to which I am but why should I put up with her if she is nasty to me and to people i care about.

My sister sent an ""apology"" letter afterwards to me and my gf in which she basically states that it's basically my fault for not letting my gf know about the rule that I can't bring anyone over without my sisters permission, which is absurd and something I never agreed to.
Right now it's been almost 24h and I'm just as pissed as i was yesterday when it happened. I'm seriously considering moving out now and just cutting ties with her.
So AITA and WIBTA if I did this?

tldr: Long Distance gf surprises me by showing up behind my door suddenly to which my sister without meeting her gets upset that I broke a non-existent rule where we arent allowed to bring anyone from the opposite sex over.",False,everyone sucks,5,25.0,1,"WIBTA if i cut out my sister from my life due to how she behaved with my girlfriend? 26285,26285,befd4o,1555548470.0,AITA For calling my wife out for possibly being racist?,"My Wife(29F) and I(29M) are trying to sell a car that we have. We live in a larger city. My wife made a post online, and people have been contacting her to take a look at the car. I am at work and unable to show the car to potential buyers. My wife says some of the people are ""Ghetto as hell"" and I told her she shouldn't judge people by how they speak or look. They are trying to look at the car and potentially buy it. Someone has already made an offer, but much lower than the asking price and she is no longer fielding any other offers because she feels that at least it will be ""safe"" to sell to this person.
We do have two children, and I understand that she might feel unsafe, but the other potential buyer is also a large man, except that he is white, and she feels comfortable to sell to him??

I told her she is discriminating against these other potential buyers because she perceives them to be too ""Ghetto"". She got real upset and told me I'm basically calling her a racist. She is all for social justice and definitely not racist (I'm mixed race).
After I said this I got radio silence, no text responses, and she won't answer my phone calls. AITA?

Update: My wife was actually on this sub this morning, found this post and asked me if I had posted it. I told her I did, and we had a discussion. As it turns out, I think ITAH here. After I got home from work, the two guys she ended up selling the car to may have actually fit the ""Ghetto"" stereotype, but she had no problems selling the car to them. She has always been an ally of all people of different cultures, races, and orientations, but since I was at work, frustrated about not getting the car sold, I ~~probably~~ said those things to just push things forward. She was really just looking out for the safety of our children.",1555611377.0,no assholes here,529,237.0,0,"AITA For calling my wife out for possibly being racist? 88181,88181,eh2htd,1577599671.0,AITA? Snapped at Friend Who Called My Kids Spoiled at Christmas,"DH(48) and I (44F) rented a cabin in the woods over Christmas for 10 days.  We invited friends FF(45) and MF (48) and their DS(14) and DS(19).  We have twins DS(10) &amp
column2: amp
column3: DD(10) and DS(4). And 3 cats. We’ve known them for years. The cabin is split in two living sections with a door between.

column1: First night was ok but FF seemed a bit grumpy.  The next day she barely spoke to us except for to say how loud and chaotic our side was (ha ha joke joke) and how she slept so badly. Night 2 &amp
column2: amp

column1: Christmas morning we open gifts separately. We got our kids nice gifts but nothing crazy. They came in after gifts. FF looked around and said, wow you kids are spoiled.  Note: a month ago DD came home in tears when a kid called her spoiled so I knew this would be hurtful to her especially.
I looked up and said (maybe snapped?), “not spoiled.”.

FF yelled, “why do you always correct me? “. (I don’t recall ever correcting her!)  I replied, “no I’m sorry it’s just that DD had an issue about this at school and plus they aren’t spoiled.” FF repeated, “well I can say what I want and they are spoiled! Spoiled and lucky!” And stomped out.

DS(10) came to me and asked what spoiled meant and i said it means rotten, like when a fruit or egg spoils, or when a kid gets too much stuff or their parents give them too much. I said, I think maybe she doesn’t know what it means. Suddenly she storms in (eavesdropping) and screamed,” you’re an effing liar!!  You told him I said he was rotten!” I told her he asked the meaning and I showed him the dictionary definitions on my phone. Edit: I did say both definitions but she only overheard the word “rotten” and extrapolated the rest. I edited this paragraph to reflect that.

I went away from the kids outside and asked her to talk. She said she meant the kids were lucky and spoiled means lucky.  I said, do you know the definition of spoiled?  She didn’t answer so I repeated (later DH said this came across aggressive). Then I said this is obviously a misunderstanding and I’m sorry, next time I will talk to you in private. She lost her temper saying I embarrassed her and said I was basically a bully. I apologized again and said that if I ever do anything please tell me so I can fix it.  She couldn’t come up with any examples. Everything I said made her more and more mad. It came up that her sleep issue was because we were too loud.  I said next time tell us the first day and we can figure it out.  She said she did say so.  (Complaining about noise and sleep apparently meant it was us.)  I said sorry again and please just tell me things directly as I’m not good at reading between the lines.  We were really quiet the next two nights after this.  I actually didn’t know until then they could hear us - they are super quiet.
The following two days she seemed somewhat better but grumpy.  I asked if I could give her a hug and she said maybe tomorrow. They left this morning 5 days early with no explanation.

After discussing with DH I think I should have walked away and given her time and not pushed to resolve the conflict, but he and I don’t think it was wrong to say, “not spoiled” except maybe do it in private next time.  AITA?

INFO: DS got a fish tank, a small Star Wars drone and a lego set, DD got a karaoke party machine, small speaker, augmented reality recipe book, DS2 got DemoDuke and one of those tonka things you can sit and dig with outside.  Plus a couple of family board games for everyone.  Their sons got a bunch of clothes and the younger got a VR for his PlayStation.  I do know they are short on money this month but there wasn’t anything I thought was excessive or upset anyone.

INFO2: FF has been dating MF for 5 years.  Previously MF dated my sister for 4 years.  Didn’t want to mention that up front to not bias.  She said on this trip that she doesn’t trust me. 56016,56016,crmpn5,1566051573.0,WIBTA if I (35f) decided to keep my hair that I was growing out to specifically donate?,"Background info: Most of my adult life I’ve had short-ish hair. My motto was always, “It’s just hair, it’ll grow back.” My cosmetologist older sister gave me a major complex about my hair when I was younger resulting in me HATING my hair (I suffer from extreme childhood ptsd).

About 7 years ago I had a little cousin diagnosed with a rare cancer. She was 14 and afraid of loosing her hair to chemo. At the time my hair was just shy of my shoulders (the longest I ever let it get), and I promised to shave my head when she lost her hair. I did just that. Unfortunately she lost her battle after 14 months. That entire time I kept my hair short like hers. When she passed I decided to grow my hair out to donate in her memory. I’ve been growing it since and it’s half way down my back now.

Now that it’s years later and my hair is long enough to donate I’ve grown quite attached to it. Everyone knows why I decided to grow it out, though. My mom frequently asks when I’ll cut it to donate it. I’ve never been attached to my hair before because of my sister and the residual guilt is killing me.
Would I be an asshole if I kept my hair?

50101,50101,ciw0gm,1564321710.0,AITA for excluding MIL out of my life as well as my child's,"CONTEXT:
I (23 F) left my family due to the abusive (physical and mental) nature of the relationship. I'm Asian and my father is a pastor who is quite traditional and sexist. I am not in touch with them.

My husband (26 M) 's parents got a divorce when he was little and they both remarried to other people. He lived with his mom and occasionally visited his dad whenever it was convinient for my FIL. Needless to say, he saw his mom the villian and his dad as the saint.

I left my family after years of struggle and moved in with my now husband. We shortly married and found out I was expecting a month after the wedding. Our first child was thoroughly planned (ovulation kit, daily temperature check, preseed, etc) so it wasn't a surprise. 9 months later, my daughter was born.

I tried to get MIL to like throughout the early part of our relationship. I visited her often by myself, cooked with her, went on walks, shopping, etc. She called me her daughter, etc. So when I was expecting, my husband and I announced. She was upset saying how she is not ready to be a grandma. She's now 47. She told me to get an abortion.
We disagreed as the child was thoroughly planned and we already set aside a lot of money for her.
I gave birth full term and my husband sent out a message to his father and his mother that I did. They both didn't reply. MIL came to visit a day later to see her grand daughter. Here is more drama.
1. She kept commenting on my belly for not going back and how I looked bloated. I just gave birth 24 hours ago.
2. She did not wash her hands to hold my daughter.
3. She did not ask me if she could take pictures of my daughter.
4. She reeked of perfume like she took a bath in it.
WHO DOES THAT?
She later shared photos that she took of my daughter to people without letting us know.

We got angry and she called us disrespectful and said all her friend's kids don't mind etc. I studied cyber security. I do not want pictures of my daughter on the internet. 91478,91478,emgp1s,1578606983.0,AITA for depriving my boyfriend of a trip with his friend?,"Anonymous as my boyfriend is an avid Reddit user.

My (26F) and boyfriend (27M) have been together for a couple of years and live in Canada. While I really enjoy traveling to foreign countries outside of North America, he prefers staying within North America. 74127,74127,dqvz6h,1572756558.0,AITA For Not Talking to my Sister?,"I (M20) have not been on speaking terms with my younger sister (F19) for a few years now. I don't really have an exact pinpoint moment or reason that I had stopped talking to her, and it was more of a slow burn. I had abysmal confidence and a terrible self image since middle school and I am still dealing with some aspects of this now. I was bullied frequently and this extended to my home life. I was not abused, but I was often berated for my hobbies, told to find ""real"" ones, and was really only praised for getting an A.

As far as my sister is involved, she started to become quite mean. I know that this can happen with adolescent girls, but it still just heaped onto the overall meanness of others in my life. The way I often reacted/coped with these things was that I would try to withdraw from them or ignore them until they left me alone. I ended up doing this to my sister whenever she was mean and avoided her often because I was not looking to be yelled at or insulted.

As high school finished I began to find people with similar interests to me and began to develop as a person. My father began to be more supportive and understanding of my hobbies and interests and could appreciate them despite having no interest in them himself. My mother did not go down this same path and still tends to criticize me for my interests and life choices. She has often approached me and demonized me for not speaking with my sister. She has communicated that she thinks I am responsible for repairing the relationship and that I must initiate this process. 18583,18583,b0p8an,1552500786.0,AITA for wanting to move to a different state before having kids?,"So my fiancé (29M) and I (26F) have been dating for almost eight years. When I was 19 I moved out of my parents’ house on the West Coast of the US where I grew up, to the East Coast to be with him. Since then we have always talked about moving somewhere warmer because even though he grew up out here on the East Coast he says he is also tired of the long, cold winters. I never dealt with seasonal depression growing up since we barely had seasons (temps in the 50s were cold to me before moving here), but it was something I had to struggle to overcome after moving out here.

We both ideally would want to move back to my home state because we both love it (he has visited my family out there with me many many times) but the area I grew up in is rather expensive. We have both researched and discussed the possibility of moving to other areas/states as a compromise, as long as they are warmer than where we are now. I absolutely love the beach and the sun and the outdoors and miss it all the time.

He has about three more years at his job before he becomes vested with the state which would be smart to do for future retirement purposes. So I figured after he is vested we pack our bags and move like we have always wanted and then we start a family.

We have never really been ready for kids up until this point but now he is starting to get baby fever a little I guess. Last night I told him I am hesitant to have kids before we move because I am afraid it would lock us down to stay here long term and we have both said we don’t want that.

Having a kid complicates things and I would feel bad putting them into one school system just to pull them out, not to mention it changes the entire financial situation. He got mad at me and said I am withholding my eggs and using it as leverage and that I’m not thinking about a family with him for the right reasons. I’m just afraid I’d still be here with our kids ten years from now looking out the window at a cold winter storm regretting not settling down somewhere I truly love. Am I the asshole for not wanting to start a family without moving first, since it may not be for a few years from now?

EDIT: I guess I should clarify that when I mentioned the school systems thing I was considering the possibility that having a kid here now might cause our financial situation to change into one where we may not be financially ready to make a big move before the child is old enough to be in school.",1552505357.0,not the asshole,14,14.0,0,"AITA for wanting to move to a different state before having kids? 16805,16805,ax0pv2,1551659660.0,AITA for crying when my mom made pork,"TL
column2: DR: Pork is basically people and I leaked eye water when mom made an unseasoned pork after I asked her not to. Since people aren't reading the post: I'm happy to cook for myself and for them. I'm expected to eat with the family. I'm not incapable of feeding myself.

column1: Ok, this requires a little backstory. I(29F) live with my parents while I go to school full time to be an X-ray Technologist. Long story really short, my dad was diagnosed with cancer last year and my parents offered to pay for me to go back to school if I moved back home and kept an extra eye on dad. (I own a house in the midwest.)

I'm about a year into my RADT program and I've seen all sorts of really nasty stuff at clinical. Part of our program requires us to spend X amount of hours in the OR(operating room) working the C-arm. Now, to the pork thing. Ever since I started in OR I developed a severe aversion to the smell of unseasoned pork as it cooked. It might have something to do with the smell that comes from cauterizing.

I'm happy to cook meals for my parents, and I am a pretty good cook. But I've asked respectfully that if they plan on making pork meals, that they heavily season it(Garlic, herbs, bbq). Mom seemed a little taken aback and asked me why. I explained that it had to do with my experience in the OR and the smells. She seemed to understand and agreed she wouldn't make pork.

So 5:30 rolls around and no one has asked me to make dinner, and it doesn't seem dinner is in the works so I figured it was a 'fend for yourself' night. I come downstairs and am assaulted by the smell of boiling pork.
Me: ""So what are you making.""
Mom: ""a ham""

OK I'm panicking. She opens the lid of the \*slow cooker\* and I see something that vaguely resembles a pale ass cheek swimming in some tan liquid. I'm sweating from nausea. 5 minutes go by and dad comes up the stairs and says, ""Can you check to see if the veggies are done?"" (I get asked to do this a lot because my parents don't know what a cooked carrot is supposed to look like, I guess.)
I open the lid and I shit you not there is a pot full of pork stock filled with potatoes, carrots and greenbeans. Literally no seasoning. Just Pork Flavored Boiled Vegetables.
Is there no pork-free option? The finished ""ham"" literally looks like the inside of someone's ass cheek while they do a posterior hip replacement.
Voice shaking I say to dad(mom is downstairs) ""I can't eat this""
Dad, ""Why not?""
Me, ""I've explained that I can't do pork...""
Dad, ""When did you say that?
Me, ""Around the time I started OR -"" I'm starting to cry.
Dad, ""Well are you going to eat it?""
Me, voice cracking ""no...""
Dad, Loudly, ""What?""
Mom comes back up stairs, ""Whats wrong?""
Me, actually crying now, ""I'm sorry I can't eat this!""
Mom makes an indignant sound and I run upstairs. And now I'm typing this story.  So reddit, AITA?
EDIT I guess I should add that our family traditionally eats together. I cried because I felt forced to sit next to the ham, not because she fixed it.

Edit: I wasn't sobbing guys, I teared up and was trying not to gag. Also, I'm perfectly capable and more than willing to feed myself in this scenario. Cause of tears was ham smell. ",1551698266.0,asshole,10,67.0,1,"AITA for crying when my mom made pork TL

27022,27022,bflgpt,1555823251.0,AITA for sending dark themed lyrics on my phone to see if my girlfriend was snooping?,"EDIT:So in order to post this, I can't use the actual song title or abbreviate it, I'm sure you can understand what the song means

So this legit just happened. I(25 M) have been dating this person (32 F) for almost a year. For the most part things have been good except she gets really jealous when I hang out with females. She claims to have severe trust issues so to ease her burden, l let her know my phone's passcode and voluntarily turned on location sharing (that was my idea)
Recently my classmate has come back into town and I've been hanging out with her and her boyfriend. My gf acts very cold every time I do and won't talk to me when I ask her if it's upsetting her.

I've been noticing my messages on Facebook have been getting opened, particularly ones with people I have been ignoring. At first I thought it was just me having a bit too much to drink but my friend said she sent me a few messages and they were not on my phone. I quickly put two and two together that my girlfriend must have deleted them.

So I decided to lay a little trap with my friends help, I copied and pasted the lyrics to biggie smalls' ""_______ Thoughts"" to my friend and left my phone out for a bit. Why did I do this instead of something else? Honestly I think I'm just a dumbass. But I know that she would have denied it if I called her out on it without proof.
In particular, I sent:
The stress is buildin' up,
I can't believe ______'s on my fuckin' mind
I wanna leave, I swear to God I feel like death is fuckin' callin' me
But no, you wouldn't understand'.

And sure enough I get back to the house to find my gf obviously panicked. a bit of back-and-forth and finally she decided to confront me about the ""note"". I told her that those were song lyrics I sent to see if she was snooping and that I was going to be leaving to go stay with my brother. She screamed at me, saying that what I did was awful and that I shouldn't take it out on her. I simply stated that I wouldn't leave if she would hand me her phone that very moment so that I could look at her stuff.

And that leads up to right now. I'm in the passenger seat of my brother's car, it's 2 am and I'm very exhausted. So, AITA?",False,everyone sucks,11,22.0,1,"AITA for sending dark themed lyrics on my phone to see if my girlfriend was snooping? Recently my classmate has come back into town and I've been hanging out with her and her boyfriend. My gf acts very cold every time I do and won't talk to me when I ask her if it's upsetting her.

I've been noticing my messages on Facebook have been getting opened, particularly ones with people I have been ignoring. At first I thought it was just me having a bit too much to drink but my friend said she sent me a few messages and they were not on my phone. I quickly put two and two together that my girlfriend must have deleted them.

So I decided to lay a little trap with my friends help, I copied and pasted the lyrics to biggie smalls' ""_______ Thoughts"" to my friend and left my phone out for a bit. Why did I do this instead of something else? Honestly I think I'm just a dumbass. But I know that she would have denied it if I called her out on it without proof.
In particular, I sent:
The stress is buildin' up,
I can't believe ______'s on my fuckin' mind
I wanna leave, I swear to God I feel like death is fuckin' callin' me
But no, you wouldn't understand'.

And sure enough I get back to the house to find my gf obviously panicked. a bit of back-and-forth and finally she decided to confront me about the ""note"". I told her that those were song lyrics I sent to see if she was snooping and that I was going to be leaving to go stay with my brother. She screamed at me, saying that what I did was awful and that I shouldn't take it out on her. I simply stated that I wouldn't leave if she would hand me her phone that very moment so that I could look at her stuff.
And that leads up to right now. I'm in the passenger seat of my brother's car, it's 2 am and I'm very exhausted. So, AITA?",25.0,M

column1: I recently met this person through a mutual friend. I am part of a local mental health group advocating for better provincial mental healthcare. One of the leaders of the group is a very close family friend of mine. I am an artist, and so this family friend let another person know I was, as they are writing a book and needed an artist to draw up a sketch for them. I added him on Facebook in order to do this.

I thought this person was a little older and had some experience and they had obviously struggled with mental health issues and they were coming out of it, hopeful and engaging in their passion and having an outlet. I felt for them and I understand that having gone through it, so I offered to do a sketch for free as it can count as volunteer work for me and show up in my portfolio.

He has absolutely no photos of himself on Facebook, so I have no idea what he looks like. Since meeting him he has been nonstop messaging me. After about 20 messages back and forth from the first ever message, he wanted to meet up. If I don’t reply fast, don’t want to call or am busy, he starts subtly guilt tripping me. I have no idea if he even knows he’s doing it. I asked him if he had the same diagnosis as I do as I used to be very similar to him when I was untreated, but he said no. He said he has anxiety, depression and tested high for PTSD. I suspected he may have BPD, as that is what I had/have (was dx'd at 16) however most of my symptoms are now invisible as I use skills and cope very well now, and only am really challenged in tough situations or actual trauma/crisis. He said he has looked into BPD/CPTSD however does not rank high on the list, which I have a hard time believing. I also asked him if he has seen a psychiatrist or therapist, and he sees a psychiatrist once a month, however he stopped taking his medication because he said he relies on them too much and they make him worse, that he's feeling better now that he is off of them. He said after he's been off of them he's attracted to that rollercoaster of emotions again. He says he's doing better and happier but then every few days says he feels like giving up, etc. He said he stopped living in (month) 2017, because of a loss he had. I sympathized for him in these past few weeks (mostly the first 1.5) and listened to his story and shared mine, which had some similarities. I think he thought this meant we were like fated to be or something. He has attempted suicide multiple times and failed, says the only language he spoke after the incident for a while was music, he dropped out in his senior year of high school and has not planned to go back yet,

He has been pressuring me into calling him as he describes himself as more of a ""voice person"". He has mentioned this and tried to get me to call him numerous times, always saying ""no pressure""! He sends multiple messages and/or almost every message is long and full of oversharing and trying to relate, saying things like ""I have anxiety too"", followed by oversharing. He apologizes a lot but it does not seem sincere, it seems more out of insecurity and trying to be ""nice"" and there’s constant guilt tripping if I don't reply much or quickly by saying things like,
• “i don’t mean to disturb you”
• “I don’t wanna bug you about anything”
• “if I’m bothering you and you’d rather me just leave you be just let me know. You could just tell me”
• “I don’t bite!”
• “have a good night. Sleep tight and sweet dreams”
• “I’ll just let you be” followed by a wall of text and “have a good day”.
• “It seems like you’re here one minute and gone the next”
• “how come you’re so against calling?”

He had a bad episode the other day and I barely replied to him that night, and the next morning he sent me 6 one minute voice messages letting me know it’s not scary for voice or to call him, and there was a lot of awkward laughing and saying things like “you really helped last night, even though you barely said much... you and x (person who I’m close family friends with) have a history of barely replying to texts \*awkward laugh\*” and “I know I said I would give you your space which I will, \*laugh\* so just reply when you’re ready” which he did not wait for my reply and later sent me a message that he found me on tinder (which I rarely go on)? He also kept mentioning how he’s not some big scary person, and how easygoing he is, how he’s a good talker and listener. He also said “I don’t wanna push any boundaries or anything obviously you have your own”. He’s been pushing my boundaries this whole time. “It feels like I’m talking to myself \*awkward laugh” like yeah, you are. It’s a one way voice message.

Another thing is that he tries to get me to talk about my personal issues. He also continuously offers for me to talk to him if I’m going through a hard time and says like if i ever am struggling and need someone he is always quick to rush to a persons side. Keep in mind I do not really know this person and have literally only talked to him for 3 weeks tops. I have been in therapy for 2 years, rarely cry now and I like to deal with my issues on my own, and if I need help I can call my therapist, use skills or reach out to one of my longterm, trusted best friends. On one of the voice messages this guy said “I know this might sound strange but I’m willing to put my problems aside for now and try to help with yours” and “It would be really nice to hear from you tonight, Maybe you can talk to me a little more about what’s going on and I can lend a hand, but that’s totally up to you, i don’t wanna be invasive or anything like that”. He has been SO invasive. He also has said ""If you ever need anything while you're really bad, I'd love to be the one you call"". ""If anything is bothering you I'm all ears :)""

He also complained the other day because his ""inspirational videos"" that are sometimes like 20mins long don't get attention in the provincial group I mentioned, and said he goes through youtube to find the best ones but nobody seems to watch them. He then went on this self depreciating and then self motivating rant of sorts where he called himself a loser, said he hated wasting time and feeling like he was wasting away, how he's tired of everything being ignored and how he wants to help people because he knows what its like and doesn't want anyone to feel the same. I agreed but said theres not a lot one person can do, as a lot of it is in the hands of that persons loved ones and ultimately the government. I agreed there is a lot to be done (which is why we have the group advocating for better mental healthcare). He then said he will put his hands in and ""do it one way or another"" and said ""I will do more than I can do"". I agree people need help but I personally know I cannot save the world. I used to be like him when I was years younger and I wanted to help and listen to everyone, but I realize now that that was just me trying to ignore my own issues and help others so I felt I had worth. It was exhausting and way over my personal limits, so I do not do that anymore for anyone other than close friends and for others I help refer them to resources locally. He started arguing that these resources aren't there and that they don't work, etc. I know they need to be increased and upgraded but again, I am one person and cannot spend all my time fixing other people. Others need to advocate for themselves and push to get care for them or their family, I cannot do that for them but I can provide information to help. Again he went on like who cares? should it have to be like this? nobody cares about me other than a few close people/family + friends (isn't that what adulthood is?) , my story is a ruthless one, ""mock and laugh all you want I will find a way"". Afterwards he was like whatever forget about the drawing I'm not going to write the book, nobody understands me or my ideals, all they do is mock me, what difference can I really make?

After sharing his personal story he felt better and decided he did want to write the book again and wants my illustrative help. He said ""Hey, you still owe me a phone call. Don't think just because I told you my story you can escape. ������"". I just said I need to hear the plot idea for the book and he said ""I feel as if it's my only leverage ��""
He started texting me on my phone as well as messenger. He text me about how he's been betrayed by friends recently, saying one bad thing after another.

At this point only did he tell me his age, which I honestly should've suspected earlier based on maturity level. He followed it up with saying his age doesn't make his story less relavent, and how people say he's mature for his age and has a lot of understanding, etc. He was very defensive while saying these things even though my messages held no judgement so I simply said a few times to stop making assumptions. He then kept apologizing and saying he didn't mean to offend me. Said these things more than once. The next day at like 3:45am he sent me walls of texts saying how he's thinking about it a lot and hope that his age wont stop ""what we had going the other night"" referring to me listening to his story and sharing mine. Then said a lot of people chuck away the severity of his story because of his age and call it ""teenage drama"", and that he hopes his age doesn't influence how much I rely on him, which I do not, at all.

He also said ""he's weird"" and set out a goal to pursue becoming friends with me, and everyday he sets out to try not to be annoying and take baby steps into getting me to talk to him so I wouldn't be shy, and he knows thats not how it works but its worth a try. I am not shy at all, I just do not text a ton and do not know this guy. He also said he read my mental health resources album not only to ""prepare himself"" but to try help me if the time came along. He says again, trying things like the voice messages was another way he tried and that he feels like this is some sort of mission. He said he started losing faith that I would open up and talk to him and doesn't know why he felt it was so important but felt we had problem similarities and after hearing my story it turns out we did. He said he was shocked I opened up (I share my story with anyone who asks, I just haven't posted it publicly) and said he knows I only really have my close circle of friends that I trust and care about but that he would love to be a part of it and would love for me to be in his. His second last of text was just saying he felt it was important to tell me, have no idea where this is going, said he's just an average weird guy who cracks dumb jokes and likes to make people laugh. The last one he just said I will let you sleep, text me tomorrow if you want, calling me an inspiration in his life, sweet dreams and goodnight. He took 2 hours to type all of these walls of texts. I did not reply and later that day he sent a text around 7 pm saying he hope it wasn't weird, and then another around 11:30am saying sorry twice and have a good night. I said I ""forgot to respond"" and he said he figured it was something I would respond to, and to have a good one.

He has now randomly showed up in my city which is nearly 2 hours away from where he lives, which he said is to check up on our mutual friend as they have had some life things come up recently. Since he arrived he has been pressuring me about it and going again with the ""I don't want to bother you"" ""no pressure"" and wants to meet up. Every day since he has been here he has been checking in about it. He has been complaining a lot because where he's staying has pets and he is very allergic. He is trying to get sympathy for it and I just sorry of asked if he has medication and can get out. Later that day he again talks more about how he's a giver and loves helping people in need and oversharing about his life.

I decided I may meet him today in the afternoon as its the only time I have available. I am going to do the drawing and then hopefully with some advice, set him straight and enforce my feelings and boundaries quite sternly and clearly, and say that I am not particularly interested in being friends or further contact unless he has finished the book and wants me to read it, and that I do want him to finish it for himself and also because of my effort. I feel that meeting him and giving him the drawing that I originally agreed to is the best way to sever ties.
Please help me in figuring out what to say / do in this scenario.
TL
column2: DR : Close friend recommends me as an artist for a person writing a book, we are all part of a FB group advocating for better provincial mental healthcare. I add the person after they reach out and agree. They begin messaging me constantly, becoming very clingy and attached, guilt tripping, pressuring me to call them and meet up, complimenting themselves and saying how mature and understanding they are, trying to pressure me to reach out to them when I'm not doing well, saying it is their mission to become friends with me and have me open up to them, hating themselves, rollercoaster style emotions, baiting me for sympathy, acting like its fate we met, judging me based on replies/reply time, seemingly acting ""fake nice"" IMO due to clinginess insecurity and need for acceptance, randomly showing up in my city and wanting to meet up, etc. Need advice on how to address these issues.",False,not the asshole,3,35.0,0,"AITA for wanting nothing to do with this guy (18M) and wanting to sternly tell him to cut the shit + cut contact? I  (19F) also posted this on advice, but I cant actually tell if I am an asshole for this or not. I am so sorry if this is a bit long (TL
column3: DR at end) but please take a few minutes to read this, as I need help ASAP. I am planning on addressing this this afternoon which is why I need help quickly, and If I am the asshole, I will need to take a different approach then I plan to now.

column1: 51330,51330,ckflpq,1564612600.0,AITA for asking my boyfriend to stop smoking,"I [22 F] have been in a relationship with my boyfriend [22 M] for almost 3 years now. We have a 1 year old daughter and a daughter born at 27 weeks that is currently in the NICU.

He smokes cigarettes and I asked him to quit, he keeps saying that nothing will change and that its his decision. I know that it is his choice but I told him from the beginning that I didn't want this around our kids and he completely agreed with me. He didn't smoke when we first started dating, this started a couple of months ago before I found out I was pregnant.

Our daughter was born at 27 weeks so she is in the NICU with sensitive lungs (she's on a CPAP and high flow right now, she did have a breathing tube) and from the beginning they warned us about smoking. Since I am currently out of work from an emergency c-section, we don't have a lot of money at the moment. We don't have enough to pay our rent and his mom was gracious enough to give us money for rent. I found out that he was spending that money on cigarettes behind my back.

He claims that he's not addicted to nicotine and cigarettes but I think he is with everything he is doing. I feel that he should be more thoughtful of his children and stop the habit before it gets worse and he truly does become addicted, especially since this is something I didn't come into the relationship with and a habit that we frankly don't have the money for.

AITA for asking him to quit?",False,not the asshole,16,32.0,0,"AITA for asking my boyfriend to stop smoking I [22 F] have been in a relationship with my boyfriend [22 M] for almost 3 years now. We have a 1 year old daughter and a daughter born at 27 weeks that is currently in the NICU.

My friends and her friends all took a trip to Atlantic City where we all paid general admission to have a good time for a DJ she was dying to see. She told me about her plans last night before I went to bed but she never asked me to drive her, only that she was going. Today when I came home from work I asked her when she was going to meet her friend. She asked me if I could drive her to the restaurant and pick her up after. This is something that she would normally do on her own without hesitation.

When I asked why, she said that she didnt feel comfortable drinking and then driving home. I told her I understand but that she should know her limit and if she didnt feel comfortable driving home, she can call and I would go pick her up. This led to a little spat that finally ended in me saying, ok fine I'll take you.

I called her and asked why she left, when I said I would take her, and she blew up at me saying that ""I didn't care about her, that she would do it for me, that I'm putting her life in danger"". Her biggest point was that, ""when someone asks you to do something, and it doesn't hurt you to do it, you should just do it without giving them any shit.""
In my opinion that's kind of entitled behavior that you have agency over someone's time just because you asked.

72345,72345,dnbdst,1572080296.0,WIBTA for asking my ex not to text my friends?,"My ex (43m) and I (26f) broke up about a month ago after a six month relationship. I broke up with him because he wasn't handling his depression well and it was starting to trigger up my own issues. He started criticizing me,
taking things out on me and I stopped seeing friends and going out because I spent so much time taking care of him.

Even though I broke up with him, he took it much better than I did. When we met a week and a half later he told me he was relieved and he was doing so much better now. He implemented almost every suggestion I had made - from getting a therapist, to meditation, to taking walks in the morning... He even rearranged the apartment the way I'd wanted it for all these months.
And no, he's not at all interested in getting back together.

I, on the other hand, was sad but managing. It was a good relationship for a long while and I was sad to see it end. I told him I didn't want to be friends. He stays friends with all of his exes, but I'm not comfortable with that.

The past two weeks he's been texting good (male) friends of mine and asking them to hang out. They all came to me first to ask and I don't know what to say. He has less friends than I do, a lot of his close friends are married with kids and don't have time. I have a big community that all lives in our neighborhood and organizes a lot of events together.

On one hand, I know he has less friends and may be lonelier than he's letting on post-breakup. I'm happy to see him reaching out and trying to make connections with people, because he usually isolates himself.

And on the other hand, I made it clear that I don't want to be in each other's lives. I feel like it's weird, especially with the age gap, to try and cozy up to my good friends (he reached out to my roommate and two of my closest friends, it's not like mutual acquaintances)

89840,89840,ejni8s,1578093072.0,AITA for not dedicating a performance to my husband,"Throwaway account.

I (25f) am an actress, and I recently booked a lead role at a substantially sized theatre in the city where my husband (30m) and I live. I have been struggling to get gigs, and so when we found this out we were both elated. He has always supported my dreams of becoming an actress, and due to the nature of his job I have been lucky enough to pursue this dream without us worrying about finances. He is the love of my life and I am so lucky to have him.

Two years ago, my best friend took his life. He was a stage manager, and we always talked about how we would move to New York and work on the same shows together. We had been friends since college, and we were each others favorite people. My husband and I met shortly after college, so they have known each other for some time and we've always all gotten along.-Side note, my best friend was gay, so there was never any kind of romantic jealousy-When he passed away, my husband was there for me every step of the way, and has been my rock through all of this.

When the time came to write a bio for the show (what shows I've been in before, college, etc.) I decided to dedicate my performance to my late best friend. I didn't even think about telling my husband, because I thought he knew how much it meant to me, and that it didn't change anything about our relationship.

However, on opening night, my husband was incredibly angry. He said that he was thrown off, and since I'm the lead, that it was embarrassing that there was another mans name in the first bio of the program. A bunch of our friends came to the show, and he said that it was embarrassing that he wasn't mentioned, after all he had done for me. I tried to explain to him about what my friend and I used to talk about all the time, but he wouldn't listen, saying he was too hurt to talk about it.
AITA? I didn't realize this would be a big deal, but from his side I can see how he would feel slighted for not being mentioned.
EDIT: I am new to reddit sorry for any mistakes

82579,82579,e80dg4,1575843105.0,"WIBTA for not going on vacation with my ""family""?","A lit bit of background on this. So I'm 18f, I have a little brother who is 15. We both live with our mom. But about a year or so my mom got a new boyfriend after being on a relationship with his ex for almost 13 years (it was like a father to us and then he disappeared). This new boyfriend has 2 kids. One is 12f and the other one 16m.

He has a lot of money. A ridiculously amount of money. Both his kids are the most spoiled brats I've ever seen. Both my brother and I grew in a modest house, we had to live with our grandpa sometimes because we couldn't afford warm water and that stuff. And I think this is important because my mom tries to put herself to his level, even tho we obviously can't. For my last birthday (September) , when I became 18, my mom gifted me a bottle of cheap wine. In November my step ""sister"" became 12, my mom gifted her an smart watch.
Now, this might sound like I'm only jealous. Well heck no. When his boyfriend is around, both my mom and him make fun of me and my boyfriend.

I gained some weight since I started college. I've always been self confident and my mom knows it, I'm dealing with depression, I've been bulimic... Well, his boyfriend won't stop mentioning how much weight I gained. My mom won't say anything. Just stare or laugh if he said it in a ""funny way"". They laugh at my boyfriend and call him ""a fagot"" for being soft and lovely, yet not very masculine, but I love him this way.
Every time I do something ""wrong"" I get seriously yelled at, so does my brother. But when one of his kids messes up, they just laugh at it and let it be.

This summer, he paid for a week on the beach for the 6 of us. I didn't enjoy it at all. I had to take care of my stepsis while my step and real bro went out and they stayed alone in the apartment. I couldn't do shit.

My mom wants us to go on vacation with them, to their house in Barcelona for a week. This week is Christmas week. So I won't see my grandpa, aunt or uncles, cousin or my boyfriend in Christmas. I want to be nice and not disappoint them, but I don't fucking want to pass a horrible Christmas week without my family.

84314,84314,eb2d46,1576433749.0,AITA for not wanting to celebrate Christmas this year?,"I (13M) do not want to celebrate Christmas this year, and am trying to avoid it as much as possible.

For a little bit of background info, last Christmas was the biggest soap opera Christmas Special ever. No, but in all seriousness, last Christmas was a genuine shitshow. My dad (45) has always been an extremely religious person, and since January 2018, there's been a lot of arguing between my parents, stuff that my brothers and sisters have all been involved in. The police have been called round 3 times, the most recent being in July of this year, and my dad was arrested. Back to Christmas 2018, my dad was FUMING because he thought my mum (45) had ruined Christmas. There was a big argument that evening, and my breathing started going funny. We'd been trying to get to my Grandmother's house, but dad was saying that nobody could leave until we sorted this out. We all got in the car anyway, but dad WOULD NOT STOP. I was crying at this point because I was so scared of him. I didn't know what he was going to do. In the end, mum decided to start driving anyway, at which point my dad opens the side door so it's up against a curve in the side of the wall in an attempt to physically stop us from leaving. This was the final push for 12 year old me, and I RAN OUT OF THE CAR, AND TOOK OFF. My mum yelled at me from down the road that if I didn't come back, she would call the police to come get me, and I said no. That's how scared I was.

After the trauma of last Christmas, and this Christmas less than a week away, I have decided I'm not celebrating it. I want nothing to do with it, but my one of my brothers and my two sisters are all saying I'm being ridiculous and stupid, and I'm going to regret avoiding Christmas. My argument is that seeing as all this arguing is still going on, I don't want to be taking any chances. They refuse to listen.
Religious dad is also not taking the hint (haven't told him, but it's obvious as fuck). I've moved my mini Christmas tree out of my room twice now, and he's forced me to put it back both times.
Am I the asshole? I'm not trying to ruin other people's Christmas, just not celebrating Christmas myself.

EDIT: Just wanted to say that my mum is amazing, and when I say she yelled, she only did this because it was Winter, which means ice, which means I could have injured myself, and the fact that it was pitch black outside, save for streetlights, which didn't really help with brightness. She was trying to protect me, so please don't see that as anything else.",1576434929.0,not the asshole,5,10.0,0,"AITA for not wanting to celebrate Christmas this year? 68489,68489,dfs5xr,1570677926.0,WIBTA for not going to my aunts baby shower?,"Sorry for the format, on mobile.

My(27F) aunt (45F) is pregnant for the first time and having a baby shower this weekend. She’s due in November. I’m also pregnant and due in January. When I told her I was having a baby too (hers was planned, mine wasn’t) she just said good luck and told me to quit smoking (which I’d done as soon as I found out, duh). Shortly after I told her my boyfriend and I were planning on getting married next June. She said she had another wedding that month and would check her schedule. At no point has she congratulated me or said anything positive about either announcement.

She’s been openly unhappy to my other family members that I’m expecting although I’ve been supportive and happy for her every step of the way. This is the tail end of years of her consistently playing the victim in every situation and bad mouthing me to anyone that would listen. She’s also decided to stop going to family events because my grandma has a cat and she doesn’t want her daughter around one. She followed that up with “And no one will even miss us since “OP” is having a baby”. I’ve always blown her off as we don’t see one another frequently and it’s easier to keep the peace.

I recently moved and my invite to the baby shower was sent to the wrong address. It wasn’t her fault, my other aunt was handling it and sent me a new one as soon as she realized. I didn’t get it until today only to find out it’s this Saturday. My fiancé and I already have plans to go to his little cousins b-day party (twin 5 y/o’s) the same day. He’s very close with their dad and I’ve become friends with their mom. Afterwards we have a reservation 2 hours away for a “babymoon” to get away one last time before our baby arrives. After how she’s acted I don’t want to change my plans. We can’t get a refund and we really need a break. So, WIBTA for sitting this one out and just sending her a gift?",False,not the asshole,44,34.0,0,"WIBTA for not going to my aunts baby shower? Sorry for the format, on mobile.

19089,19089,b1oir1,1552710343.0,AITA for telling my boyfriend it was my way or tbe highway?,"Context: [TL:DR at the bottom]

My boyfriend [19] and I [F18] have been together about a month and a half. We really just clicked in the very beginning and he's talked about how comfortable and safe he feels with me, and I honestly (even now) feel the same.

Now, he's mentioned that he can get pretty irrationally angry about stuff, but I used to be one angry motherfucker about literally anything and everything, so I didn't really mind, so long as nothing came of it.
I'm not saying I'm fail-proof, but I honestly hadn't gotten any red flags for the violent / abusive type. We were just two teenagers enjoying each other's company.
Well, tonight I got a glimpse of what he actually meant when he mentioned his anger issues.
We were walking back to his place after getting dinner and some iced tea
column2: we each had our own cups, they were just your regular plastic cups so nothing too...hard.

column1: He was walking in front of me and I made a quip about something and tapped him in the back of the leg with my foot.
He paused for half a second then whipped around and threw his tea, cup and all, right into my face. Luckily, it was iced, so I didn't get burns or anything.
I was honestly pretty angry. It got everywhere, and initially kinda hurt a little bit. I didn't say anything, I just stormed off and went back to his place to grab my shit and leave...

Well he came in about five seconds behind me, having said nothing as well. I stood there and cried and asked why he hadn't just told me he was mad that I had jabbed him, and he apologized twenty times over. He said he didn't even register the anger at first, he just reacted, but he immediately regretted it afterwards.

Here's where the AITA comes in: I told him that I wanted him to get therapy to work on his anger issues. I said that he was going to get help, or I was leaving. That if it happened again, I was leaving. And that was that.
He promised he would get help and that he felt terrible about it, and we laid down and talked for a little while longer, and now I'm home.

TL:DR: My boyfriend has mentioned he can sometimes be irrationally angry. Figured it was sort of just ""teenage boy syndrome"" and shrugged it off. Tonight, he threw his cup of tea at me. I told him he either got professional help for it or I was leaving, and I'm absolutely going to hold him to it. My way or the highway - but I'll be the one hitting the road.

Am I being too pushy? I've never handled this kind of thing before. Is there a better way I should've gone about it?",False,not the asshole,292,158.0,0,"AITA for telling my boyfriend it was my way or tbe highway? Context: [TL:DR at the bottom]

64538,64538,d7ql3u,1569159822.0,WIBTA for holding someone accountable for this,"So...I (22F) am a lesbian and a dancer. This girl I dance with, we shall call her Penelope, is bi.

Penelope was weird to me and my bi friend Ophelia last year. She refused to hug us or stretch with us. She also said that it didn't mean anything when two girls kiss, but it does mean something when a guy and a girl kiss.

I told her ""hey, when you say things like this, it's hurtful."" She freaked out, reported me to the leader of our group, and refused to apologize until our group leader said, ""you have to apologize. We aren't leaving the room until you do.""

Penelope left at the end of the year last year. She said she was transferring schools. But she isn't. She's coming back and is thinking about rejoining. Our new group leader brought up the situation from last year and Penelope said, ""I feel bad and want to apologize."" Our group leader told her to write me an email explaining what she felt bad for, why she felt bad, and what she would do to make things right.

I was expecting her to write something like, ""I'm sorry that I made you feel excluded last year. I know it's not an excuse but I was struggling with a lot of internalized homophobia and I'm sorry I took it out on you.""

The thing is, in her apology letter, she doesn't own up to anything specific. She says things like ""we're both different people than we were last year"" and ""there were a lot of misunderstandings"" and ""I'm sorry if you didn't feel supported.""

I don't know if she understands exactly what she did. I feel like she would be pretty oblivious if she didn't, but she is aggressively self-centered. I also feel like her apology puts the onus on me by saying I just misunderstood and that we have both changed.

WIBTA if I said that wasn't good enough and that I gave her a chance already?",False,not the asshole,4,19.0,0,"WIBTA for holding someone accountable for this So...I (22F) am a lesbian and a dancer. This girl I dance with, we shall call her Penelope, is bi.

57538,57538,cugeh7,1566578487.0,AITA for shutting my mom down?,"My mother is overweight. I do not judge her for that. My problem is the uncomfortable situation she creates for me (22F) and my brothers (13M and 14M). She’ll often make these comments to us like, “I’m so fat!” as if she wants us to say she’s not.

It makes us uncomfortable when she does that because there is really no right answer. What are we supposed to say? “Yes”? That would be rude. And I feel saying no would be a bold faced lie for obvious reasons, and so that in and of itself would be insulting. Also, we don’t to make her feel bad because weight is such a sensitive issue, but we also don’t feel like we should have to be put in an uncomfortable position. Especially when she refuses to eat healthy or exercise. So when she starts saying stuff like that, I usually ignore her.

To make matters worse, she’ll try on an outfit and ask for feedback while criticizing her body the entire time. And no matter what I say she has a problem. If I tell her an outfit isn’t flattering she gets an attitude. If I tell her she looks fine, she says I’m lying. It’s so frustrating.

The other day she showed me pictures of herself from years ago, when she was a bit slimmer. She goes, “I was so much slimmer then. There’s such a big difference between me and this picture and me now. Don’t you agree?”
She and I both know she’s gained weight. No shade, but it’s a fact.
I told her, “That sounds like a trap question. If I say no, you are going to say I’m lying. If I say yes, you’ll be offended.”
She goes, “Its not that serious” and I reply, “Do not ask me questions like that. I do not want to answer them.”
She just scoffs and tells me I’m not being truthful. I really don’t understand the point of her doing that and I’m tired of her putting me in that awkward situation.

I (30f) have been dating my so (31) for a little over seven months. He’s a great guy, he’s passionate about his hobbies (he's a drummer in a semi-successful band), and has been very understanding as I have dealt with the aftermath of an emotionally abusive ex. We talk about our future often, and we spend a lot of time together, and I feel happy.

I am writing here because before traveling home for Thanksgiving, I was helping him get ready for a trip. I was pulling briefs out of a drawer for him, under one stack was a folded up piece of computer paper, and printed out was a list of upwards of 40 women’s names and phrases like “blonde girl from dallas” and “freckles.” My name, along with a few others, was added in red pen at the bottom.

I asked him what it was, and he said it was just a list he and his bandmates came up with a long time ago of people he has had sex with while they were on tour, and he just kept it up afterward. I got really upset, and he kept telling me that it does not matter because it’s all in the past and he’s with me now and that’s what matters.

I asked him why he felt the need to keep the list, and he said it was so he didn’t “forget his past.” I’ve always known he’s been with a lot of people, but I felt really sad when I saw all the names of these other women, regardless of how unimportant they were to him.

I asked him to throw it out and he told me I was overreacting. Am I the asshole for getting upset over this? I don’t think of myself as jealous, but it’s made me feel resentful since finding it last week, especially since he will not get rid of it. 13411,13411,ap7vzx,1549829840.0,AITA for wanting 2 years to myself before i make a career decision of whether i wanna get into our family business or not?,"I (F22), just graduated college and took a gap year cuz of reasons I'm gonna enlist below.

So pausing for a minute to give a family BG. I am the youngest out of 5 sisters. So around 4 years ago, around this time, all of my sisters either got married or got incredible career offers and moved away from our not so big, humble city. Leaving me behind with our parents to take care of. Now, before it irks you, my parents are old and my dad has glaucoma, so they need one of us to be there for them.

Where I'm from, it's not frowned upon if you don't go away for college but it's still something that has started to catch on with people here. Of course, it did so with me too, and when I had to stay back for my degree, I got thrown into a mess of depression, anxiety and low self confidence. I have blamed everyone for making me stay back, and for my mental health deteriorating. But never to their faces, because they try, they really really do! But they don't do enough, and I swear I don't blame them.

However, in these 3-4 years, my father apparently saw this ability in me to excel in our family business (I have helped him with many things in his business, and gradually started doing so quite regularly). He now wants me to stay back and get into the business full-time, and not leave for my higher studies.

So, am I the asshole for wanting to go out for 2 years to see what is out there and then make the decision? Also, do I sound extremely bratty for having this cushion of having the business to get back to when all else fails, and yet still almost cribbing about it?
TL
column2: DR Father wants me to get into family business, while I want to go out for higher studies for at least 2 years and weigh my options then. column1: 42291,42291,c7lw2u,1561941650.0,AITA for not picking up my brother?,"My (20F) brother (30) lives with my parents and I. My mom drives him to the train to get to work every morning and picks him up when he’s done. He typically works 8-5 at a restaurant.

We’re in Canada so today we had a BBQ for the Canada day long weekend, because most people wanted tomorrow to stay home and relax so we hosted a day in advance rather than the day of Canada day. My brother knew we were having people over. Everyone came over around 4.

Anyways my brother called to get a ride home at 6. My parents had already had too much to drink so they couldn’t go get him. They asked me to. I had much less to drink, but I did have 2 full cocktails. I have a level 2 (out of 3) drivers license so I’m allowed to drive by myself but I’m not supposed to drive with ANY alcohol in my system. 0. I said I wasn’t comfortable driving him since I had alcohol in my system too. Additionally I’m very small (5’4, 100lbs) so I think alcohol has a different affect on me then someone who’s taller and weighs more than me.

My brother had to take a taxi home and was extremely pissed at all of us, but especially me since I wasn’t drunk at all. I think I made the right decision. 82926,82926,e8lx0k,1575953237.0,AITA for not wanting to rush into marriage.,"I (22M) and my fiance (22F) have been engaged for a total of 2 weeks now, and we have been dating for 3 years before that. She is very excited for the ceremony (Note we do not live together at the moment. I am in another state with a nice job to get my foot in the door but I am moving back this summer). Her brother is about to finish up his classes in the Navy and could potentially be deployed for up to 4 years accordingly.

She just got done talking to me and we were discussing a date in which we would get married. I said in \~2-3 years of living together, which would give me time to graduate college with a bachelors, and save a little money for an open bar at the wedding. She was thinking more of \~1 year of living together. We discussed this very well in depth and I said something along the lines of ""You know what. A year of living together should be plenty of time to know whether or not we want to fully commit. 1 year sounds good.""

Well she just got word from her brother that he will for sure be deployed around May this summer. With the chance of it lasting up to 4 years, my fiance was not very happy with it. She for sure wants her brother here to walk her down the aisle since her ""dad"" is, well... A dick... So she asked me just now if we could plan and arrange a wedding in 5 months from today.

I said there is no need to rush it, and we can wait until he comes back, or has any visit time in which we can plan around. Now she seems upset that I don't want to marry her because I said I do not want to rush in. I love her very much, and don't have a problem with marriage between us, but I don't know if rushing to become married is a smart idea.
tl

column1: 67336,67336,ddbww0,1570216217.0,AITA for parking in an unused spot?,"So I (34 M) recently moved into a new apartment with my wife (30 F) close to the hospital we work at. My wife and I have different on call schedules and have two cars so that if I am on nights she can still get to work and vice versa.
Our apartment has 7 spots in its parking lot, total, and 7 apartments. Across the street there is paid parking that is usually full.

We have been using two spots after hearing that one of the tenants (Yvonne 70's) doesn't own a car (information she offered up of her own accord on our first meeting). During the first week I had one note put on my windscreen saying that this parking lot was for tenants only, I responded by putting a note saying I was a tenant in the building. Since that time I have bumped into Yvonne a few times and we have been pleasant to each other.

Today I was coming home and as I was pulling into the parking lot a different neighbor (Sally) who I've not seen before was coming out of her car next to the spot I was planning to put my car. She she's me and pojtedly stands in the spot making a phone call while staring daggers at my direction. After waiting for about 10 minutes I started to pull near the spot and this and Sally comes to my window and says basically there is a one car, one apartment rule. (there's nothing in my tenancy agreement to stating this). I state that I know there's an empty spot here as Yvonne has told me that she doesn't own a car, and Sally rejoins that it doesn't matter the rules are the rules and she's willing to stand in the spot all day if she must and would also be making a call to my landlord regarding this.
My wife when I told her the story said she'd move her car as most of the time goes into work with me, and would not need her car, and could bike into and out of work when she's on nights.

Now the question is am I the asshole for using 2 cars in two spots when I know for a fact that one spot is free 100% of the time, and there are no rules in my tenants agreement regarding this?",False,not the asshole,5,36.0,0,"AITA for parking in an unused spot? 18812,18812,b12hh0,1552581381.0,AITA because I don't want to apologize for getting my friend grounded?,"Throwaway because my friends know my Reddit.

There are five us in our friend group ranging from 23 to 15 and we are doing a challenge. Anytime someone in the group calls you, you have to answer on speaker no matter what. The only exceptions are school, funerals/weddings, and church. We all put a hundred bucks in a jar and the last one to not answer the phone wins the game. Two of our friends have already dropped out so all that is left is me(F15), my boyfriend Q(15), and our friend R(M16). We've been going back and forth for about 2 weeks at this point.

Well, Q and I decided to call R after school while we were working on our homework and the call went like this. We called him, he answered and Q asked him if was excited for this raging college party on Friday night our oldest friend(M) got us into, btw there was no party, and R was confused. Q and I jokingly tried to remind him of all the booze and drugs that would be there and he kept denying it, growing more and more nervous to the point of stuttering. The nail of the coffin came when I said something along the lines of ""You remember Clarissa, that smoking hot senior from M's sorority? Well she can't wait for you to do more body shots"" Q died laughing and we expected the same from R but all we heard was his mom yelling at him to hang up, so he did. Yesterday at school R told us we got him grounded, his phone confiscated and chores up to his eyelids. Not to mention he isn't allowed out of the house unsupervised for two months.

R told us to go fuck ourselves and hasn't spoken to us since. Q felt bad and apologized to him and is somewhat on his good side but I kinda don't feel bad. He could've said when he answered the phone that his mother was there like we all do when we get a call with our parents nearby but he decided not to. I feel bad that he got put on essentially house arrest but I don't regret the call. The group is split down the middle with M on my side and our other friend on R's side. Q is on the fence but is trying to get me to apologize so we can all just be friends. I refused and still do.

But I've been thinking about it more and I don't know if I'm in the wrong here for not apologizing so I came here to Reddit during my class freetime. Am I the asshole here?",False,asshole,6,29.0,1,"AITA because I don't want to apologize for getting my friend grounded? Throwaway because my friends know my Reddit.

49131,49131,chqfho,1564074135.0,WIBTA if I put my dog down?,"My husband (44M) and I (34F) have a male labrador retriever. We've had him since he was a puppy and he's now 4.5 years old.

Since he was a puppy and until today we're not able to approach him while he's eating because he turns violent: first growling and then barking. We warn all our visitors to not give him food and avoid him when he's eating. He has also always been afraid of loud noises. For a few weeks now he stopped sleeping in his bed and he now naps and sleeps in our closet.

In January we moved to Canada where we have a new home, new friends and a completely different weather than what he was used to back in Mexico. We thought he was fine until he bit me in May. He was licking a bone I had just given him, I crossed my legs and he came at me from almost 2 meters away and grabbed my arm. I ended up in the emergency room, I was 3 months pregnant then (I'm still pregnant now btw).

We engaged a behavior specialist and he told us our dog was acting out of fear. He suggested a few training exercises, which we aced, so we thought everything was on the right path until he attacked my husband and a few days later he went for my foot. He didn't do any damage, but he attacked when no food was involved. Since then, we started setting up boundaries, our dog was not allowed in the kitchen and living room anymore. We noticed the banning from those places upset him, but we felt it was necessary because we now didn't know what triggered an attack. At this point, we knew we would never be comfortable with having him near our kids, so we started looking to rehome him, even after our behavior specialist and our vet advised to put him down because they think the issue is neurological.

Last week my husband hosted a BBQ at our home and our dog bit one of our friends as he was passing in front of the dog's bed while he was there. He drew blood and actually damaged our friend's leg. We've now decided to put him down, because we haven't found a farm (someplace open) that will take him and I honestly feel like we're living with a time bomb that might go off anytime. I don't want him to bite me or anyone else again.

I might sound cold retelling this story, but I can honestly tell you that these last few months have been a very painful journey for me and my husband. We have a baby on the way and we always thought our doggie would meet our kids and grow old with them. I don't think the guilt of moving and failing our dog will ever go away.
So reddit, WIBTA if I put my dog down?

EDIT: I just want to say that this is our first dog ever. I'm not delusional enough to say we did everything right during his training, but we researched and we saw a lot of training tutorials when we did this. He's trained to heel, sit, lay down, go to bed and we have ALWAYS taken him out twice a day for a walk. His only issue used to be around his food and we managed to avoid it, I realize this was a big mistake on our side. Thanks for all your comments: the good and the bad ones.

EDIT 2: We looked into surrendering him to a shelter and we even had our behavior specialist write a letter with his diagnosis. We're looking for a home with no kids and a very large field so he can live outside, but please note that this is Canada and winters are bad so these kind of places are not common. We were told by the shelter that the dog will be evaluated, but with his history, there's a big chance he'll be put down. I just don't want to endanger other people...",1564077122.0,not the asshole,4,42.0,0,"WIBTA if I put my dog down? My husband (44M) and I (34F) have a male labrador retriever. 42036,42036,c757l5,1561845661.0,"WIBTA If I told my coworker to stop telling me ""I'll understand when I have MY OWN kids""?","Throwaway because I don't want this person to see my account.
TL: DR at the end.
I (25F) work in a very small office with 3 other people, one of them being my coworker Gary.
Gary is a parent in his late 30's, married, with two kids.

I'm newer to the step-mom scene. In fact, legally I'm not a step-mom. I'm engaged to my wonderful fiancé, Jared(30M). Jared has two daughters that are 6 and 11. We own a home together, the girls have their own space, and we have custody of the youngest 60% of the time. Both the girls mothers wished me a Happy Mothers Day and I did the same for them.

Now, that being said when we have discussions about children Gary likes to try and ""reassure me"" that I will ""understand when I have my own kids"". Just recently he was asking if we were bringing the girls to a day camp next month. He makes sure to always include my fiancé Jared's name in the conversation as if I could not do anything with them myself.

I let him know that we work and that we don't usually have the girls during most of that time per our custody arrangement but that my mom could bring them the last day. (We have our 6-year-old Friday-Tuesday and the 11-year old is here for the summer but goes back to spend the week before and that specific week with her mom, they BOTH will be back the last day of this event). He got flustered and told me that our custody arrangement was confusing and I will really love having ""my own child"" because I won't have to deal with that nonsense. I did combat this and said if we planned ahead we could have worked this out as we change schedules easily but this thing was not one we wanted to prioritize. This apparently frustrated him even more. He let me know it was ""different"" when you have your own kids as you can do what you want with them. He followed it up with letting me know that things will change after we have a child of our own because we won't get a break from them like we do right now.

This really rubbed me the wrong way as I think of the children as my own and I'm really sick of him telling me that I don't understand things because they are not mine. I do not know what in his mind disqualifies me as a parent when the children and their moms think of me as their step-mom. In my culture we do not say things like step/half/adopted, family is just family. My fiancé is from the same culture as well so its really lovely to not have to explain this. I feel blessed that his family, the girls, and their mothers love me and accept me as a step-mom. I don't know what to do honestly because it's not like he is going to stop being my coworker anytime soon.

83020,83020,e8sl6v,1575994235.0,WIBTA for going to a rave even though it makes my boyfriend upset?,"So I've been into the rave scene for a while, but I don't go very often. I usually save up to go to the really big festivals instead of regularly attending smaller shows. I genuinely enjoy the music, but I would be lying to say I don't also go for the fun of spending the weekend fucked up. I wanted to go to EDC in Las Vegas (it's in May 2020) and I found someone selling their ticket on fb, so I decided to buy it (it's already sold out). I know two other people who are going, and they got a camping pass and said I could camp with them, and basically everything seemed to be working out for me.

Then, I (22M) mentioned it to my boyfriend (24M) and he got really upset. We've been together for two years, so he knows I like to go to shows, and he even came with me to one last year but he said it wasn't really his scene. He told me he's never been crazy about raves and music festivals, and after going to one he thinks it's basically just an excuse for people to do drugs. He said he's really uncomfortable and a little scared at the idea of me ""being on a bender for three days straight"" at a festival with hundreds of other people who are also tripping balls. He doesn't think it's safe, and told me he doesn't want me to go at all. Since the show we went to together, I haven't been to another so I guess he didn't feel the need to mention it until now, but he's really emotional about this. He said he just doesn't trust raves/people who go to raves and I said since I already bought the ticket I'm going to go anyway. I told my friend about this, and they said if me going to raves makes him this upset I should prioritize his feelings because it doesn't hurt me to not go, but it will hurt him if I do go.
The show isn't until May so I have a lot of time to change my mind, but I thought I would ask now anyway. So, Reddit, AITA?
tl
