column1: 81605,81605,e6atz2,1575514853.0,AITA for not inviting two sexist guys on a group trip?,"My friends and I used to have the tradition of a weekend get-together every summer, but for the past few years our trips have been a bust. This year I figured I’d take the wheel and plan a trip. Some of the group had drifted apart since early college (we’re in our early 20s), including two guys--let’s call them Tim and Ian.

Now, I’d never been close to Tim or Ian. I also never felt 100% comfortable around them, as they consistently made sexist/objectifying comments to us girls (e.g. always body-shaming one of my friends) and weren’t always with social cues. I didn’t want to ruin the group dynamic, though, so I never opposed when they were included in events. But a year or two ago, us girls are hanging out and I learn they all felt the same about Tim and Ian.  Not to mention neither guy had been coming to events for a while now, so I figured it’s the natural drift that happens after high school.

Present day, I decide who’s invited to the trip and my friends approve of the list. Tim and Ian’s names never pop up. Trip happens and we have a good time, take a bunch of pictures, which we post on Facebook.

Then Tim comments on one of the group pics: “Thanks for the invite.” Obvious sarcasm, but I’m taken aback - none of us have hung out with/seen him for 2+ years. Since I planned the trip and was never friends with him beforehand, it didn’t cross my mind to invite him.

A day after that, my best friend texts me a screenshot of Ian’s Facebook status post: “ever go online and see friends do shit without inviting you? Yea, does wonders for the mood”.  We know it was a call-out to us, since Ian doesn't know many people, and we’d just gone on the trip so he would’ve seen it on his timeline.

Part of me was irked since I generally dislike how people vent passive aggressively on Facebook, but also I shrugged it off, since neither dude is/was in my life and, well, not everyone from the old group made the cut for the same reasons. My best friend and I agreed that Tim and Ian’s comments seemed immature, but we weren’t gonna press it.

I don’t doubt that it might’ve hurt their feelings and didn't intend for that, but at the same time I don’t feel...guilty? I’m more confused as to how they still consider themselves friends of the group when they haven’t talked to/seen most of us for 2+ years, don’t respect some of the girls in the group, and haven’t reached out to anyone? Idk, Reddit, does this make me TA?",False,not the asshole,6,12.0,0,"AITA for not inviting two sexist guys on a group trip? 43813,43813,cagne9,1562561297.0,WIBTA if I just decided to drop all these people?,"So today is my birthday. For about two weeks now I've been talking to my relatively small circle of friends about getting together to do something. The 5 of us were all off today and the one friend with a child had a sitter, so by all accounts this was a small miracle. Even before my birthday, we've been trying to get together for a while now. They asked what I wanted to do and I explained that I didn't really care, I just wanted to see my friends. I told them I wasn't really interested in planning some huge day for myself so if it was up to me, we'd all just meet at a bar and maybe catch a movie. Two of them said they would plan something. Me, being the one who doesn't want a huge show of my birthday said that's fine, but ultimately I'd be happy to just meet up at a bar to catch up on life if they didn't want to plan some huge thing. They insisted they'd plan something for me though.

We never made any solid plans but agreed we'd get together today. Well today comes around and nothing happened. 3 of the 5 went ghost, not even a birthday wish. One of them said happy birthday, then went ghost in the group chat. The final one, I'll call him B, who's been basically my best friend for over a decade asked what I wanted to do today. B was one of the two that insisted they'd plan something. I brushed it off and again suggested we just meet up at a bar, but I wanted to wait until a little later in the day to go and suggested we meet up around 5p. B, now the only one responding says that works.
5p rolls around and even B isn't responding. 7p comes and I message the group chat again saying ""so...?""

B responds now saying that it's kinda late for him now, but if I still wanted to do something we could. I just told him not to worry about it and then left the group chat. I'm pretty offended already that after months of trying to get together and over a week of talking about actually doing something for my birthday, everybody bailed. Now the icing on the cake is when I'm going through Snapchat and see that B is out somewhere with some of his other friends. I replied to one and just said ""bruh...""

Reply from B said ""yeah I just wanted to see them, but that was earlier today"" apparently not realizing that Snapchat time stamps your story so I could see that he clearly decided to go out with this other set of friends and blew me off. I said ""it's fine, just, thanks for the invite"" which was admittedly passive aggressive, but seriously, you said you'd plan something then just left me hanging, on my birthday to go hang with other friends.

WIBTA if I just ghost these people? I understand things come up and the world doesn't revolve around me, but everyone has a cellphone and a single sentence saying sorry I can't make it, takes less than two minutes to type and send. Should I explain why I'm upset or do you think they should know? Or am I just taking this too personally?",False,not the asshole,4,18.0,0,"WIBTA if I just decided to drop all these people?
